metadata.synopsis: Karlach breaks the forth wall with the player.
metadata.how_to_trigger: CURRENTLY CAN NOT BE TRIGGERED! To be discussed with Sarah what to do with this branch.

23.speaker: Karlach
23.text: Hey - can I try something on you?
23.context: InternalNodeContext: This should be its own camp moment. Can go anywhere in the game that we feel Karlach needs something to do.NodeContext: mischievously

86.speaker: Karlach
86.text: A... technique I learned. From one of Zariel's clerics. But it's nothing scary, I promise.

5.speaker: Karlach
5.text: See, they could look into someone's eyes and tell if they were lying or speaking true. More useful than torture and totally painless.

45.speaker: Karlach
45.text: They taught me a thing or two, but I haven't practised in a good long while. I'm curious to see if my chops are still choppy.

10.speaker: Karlach
10.text: Woo! Thank you. This is going to be fun.

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: Just stand comfortably. Look me in the eyes. And...
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera changes to first person. Karlach is looking directly into camera, looking into the player's eyes at home on the screen.

90.speaker: Karlach
90.text: Funny. I know you're telling the truth, but I'm sensing something different. Let me try something else.

34.speaker: Karlach
34.text: You speak true. I know you do. But I'm sensing something different. Let me try something else.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: There we are. Baseline established. Next question: How are you feeling right now?

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Unsure of exactly where this is going.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: Good stories, good sex, life itself - they all share the element of unpredictability. Settle in!
43.context: NodeContext: Good-natured, not cutting or sarcastic

12.speaker: Karlach
12.text: Now, next question. The next question I have for you is... is... hello? What's happening here?
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Her demeanour suddenly changes, like something has possessed her.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Hello yourself. You all right in there?

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: Strange question. You have to tell the truth. But you can't, really. Nor I. You're just like me. And everyone we know.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: You were trying out some kind of truth spell on me. Not sure what's gone wrong.

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: I don't think it has. I think... I think it's truly worked for the first time.

18.speaker: Karlach
18.text: I can see it, you know. The grand design. It isn't what we think. It's us.

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: I see... a great web. Intersecting lines - permutations - and behind them, chaos. And then the hand that decides: yes, no. But it barely knows itself.
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: She speaks as if in a daze. Then she shakes her head in consternation, trying to clear her head. In a moment, she looks at you directly again.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: Tell me - tell me now. Do you know how all of this ends? You, me, this adventure?

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I'm not sure; I haven't gotten there yet.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: We'll do what we always do: kill the bad guys and ride off into the sunset.

87.speaker: Karlach
87.text: It's like you've done this before. Have you?

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Well, I've journeyed to Baldur's Gate once or twice, if that's what you mean.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: I knew it. You just want to go where you've been. But you never can; I never can. We're stuck here in the future. Together.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I've had a few adventures under my belt by now.

35.speaker: Karlach
35.text: I'm so jealous. I'm stuck here, forever here. In these tangled lines, in these hundred hours, or less, or more...

32.speaker: Karlach
32.text: There's only one thing I need to know. One thing I have to know. Then I can be all right.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I'm having a lot of fun.

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: Thank the gods. Thank the gods. We did it! We've done it, everyone! Yes!
4.context: NodeContext: Genuine happiness and excitement, relief, looking around her like she's talking to a group.

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: Phew! That was wild. Thanks for playing along.
92.context: CinematicNodeContext: BAck to herself. She shakes her head as though something is leaving her, returning her to her normal state.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: What happened to you? It's like you were possessed.

84.speaker: Karlach
84.text: I don't think so, soldier. I feel fine! Might've gotten lost in the moment but believe me, I'm me.
84.context: NodeContext: Looks at you like you're the crazy one

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: Careful now or I'll subject you to more devilish parlour tricks. I know how to make a copper piece appear from behind your ear, you know.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Don't ever use your devil magic on me again.

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: Ouch. Sorry. If I'd realised you'd end up in such a snit, I wouldn't have asked.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: Hope you can squeeze a nap in - you need it.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: A little weirded out, but yes. I am.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: What in the hells is happening?

21.speaker: Karlach
21.text: The only thing that can be happening. Here we are. Together. Now.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I want to stop; this game is terrible.

28.speaker: Karlach
28.text: I'm sorry. I'm really sorry. I promise I tried my best.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: This is all as new to me as it is to you.

88.speaker: Karlach
88.text: At least we can do it together. The hidden joys. The little secrets.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: You'll end this magic and we'll speak no more of it.

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: You speak like you know. But you don't know. They know. And I think I know, now, too.

100.speaker: Karlach
100.text: I want to know what's coming. I want to know how this will end. Have you done this before?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I think you're having some kind of reaction to this technique.

36.speaker: Karlach
36.text: No. Don't you see? This is it. The truth behind our truth.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Stop this, Karlach; we've gone far enough.

47.speaker: Karlach
47.text: I'm finally seeing. I see it all.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You seem to be talking about the question of free will. Are we ourselves, or do we operate according to some unknowable plan?

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: It's suddenly obvious. I do as I'm told, don't I. Don't I? Or...

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I think you're talking about the gods. That their will for us affects the shape of our lives.

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: Torm, Lathandar, Beshaba, Mystra. Are these their names? Are we sure of that?

29.speaker: Player
29.text: You're dabbling in devilish magic. Stop this.

56.speaker: Karlach
56.text: It isn't that. That's not a real spell. None of these spells are real. We're just enzymes in a great churning bath...

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: All right, let's see if we can shake things up, then.

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: You can have a snack when I'm finished with you.

99.speaker: Karlach
99.text: Well that's a lie. Baseline established. Next question: How are you feeling right now?

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I'm done with this - let's stop.

20.speaker: Karlach
20.text: Whatever you say, soldier. I'll have to find another amenable soul for my fiendish experimentations...

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: Haha! Stupid. Come on, for real this time.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: So you want me to be your test subject for a not-technically-torture technique?

15.speaker: Karlach
15.text: Yes! This is going to be fun.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.text: Fair enough! I'll drop the subject. Maybe someone else would be willing to give it a shot...

102.speaker: Karlach
102.text: Excellent. It's risk-free, I promise. Something I picked up from one of Zariel's clerics.

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: Let me explain. It's a technique I picked up from one of Zariel's clerics - used to elicit the truth from subjects. Totally painless, totally risk-free.

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: I haven't practised in a good long while, though. I'm curious if I can still pull it off.
